definitions.definition: The point of interconnection or contact between entities.
examples: Public relations firms often serve as the interface between a company and the press.

definitions.definition: A thin layer or boundary between different substances or two phases of a single substance.
examples: If water and oil are mixed together, they tend to separate, and at equilibrium they are in different strata with an oil-water interface in between.
The surface of a lake is a water-air interface .

definitions.definition: The point of interconnection between systems or subsystems.
examples: The data is sent over the air interface to the remote system.

definitions.definition: The connection between a user and a machine.
examples: The options are selected via the user interface .

definitions.definition: The connection between parts of software ; also the public or published sections of an object or module .
examples: This interface is implemented by several Java classes.

Traits are somewhat between an interface and a mixin, as an interface contains only method signatures, while a trait includes also the full method definitions; on the other side mixins include method definitions, but they can also carry state through attributes, while traits usually don't.

definitions.definition: In object-oriented programming, a piece of code defining a set of operations that other code must implement.
examples: The Audio and Video classes both implement the IPlayable interface .

definitions.definition: In some languages, a block of code declaring the interface ( point of interconnection ) between a class and code that interacts with it.
The internal surface of a coiled protein (compare exoface ).

main_definition: The point of interconnection or contact between entities.
secondary_definitions: ( chemistry , physics ) A thin layer or boundary between different substances or two phases of a single substance.
( computing ) The point of interconnection between systems or subsystems.
( computing ) The connection between a user and a machine.
( object-oriented programming ) The connection between parts of software ; also the public or published sections of an object or module .
( object-oriented programming ) In object-oriented programming, a piece of code defining a set of operations that other code must implement.
( object-oriented programming ) In some languages, a block of code declaring the interface ( point of interconnection ) between a class and code that interacts with it.
( biochemistry ) The internal surface of a coiled protein (compare exoface ).
